definition: face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: It is a mountain filled with snow perennially .
sentences.chinese: 它是一座常年披著面紗的山，山上的雪終年不化。

sentences.english: Beauty is life when life unveils her holy face.
sentences.chinese: 當生命摘去遮蓋她聖潔面容的面紗時，美就是生命。

sentences.english: The taking of the veil or the frock is a suicide paid for with eternity.
sentences.chinese: 戴上面紗或穿上僧衣是一種取得永生的自殺。

sentences.english: She put on a velvet veil then set out.
sentences.chinese: 她蒙上一塊天鵝絨的面紗然後出發了。

sentences.english: Tear aside the veils and see the divine majesty of your own Self.
sentences.chinese: 用你的真我本性撕開無明面紗，看到神奇的神性。

sentences.english: Of bug of a legendary venomous insect gobble up below, the veil of nitty-gritty is dripping blood.
sentences.chinese: 蠱蟲的吞噬下，事實真相的面紗滴着鮮血。

sentences.english: You know, dresses. Hats with veils.
sentences.chinese: 你知道，連衣裙，帶面紗的帽子。

sentences.english: She had buttoned her collar again and drawn down her veil.
sentences.chinese: 她已經扣好了領套，放下了面紗。

sentences.english: Turn the lights down low, take it off, let me show.
sentences.chinese: 調暗燈光，撩開面紗，我爲你秀。

sentences.english: Many unveiled women promenading on the arms of their male friends.
sentences.chinese: 還有一些摘掉面紗的婦女挽着女伴的胳膊散步。

sentences.english: From the Western perspective, I think a lot of people believe the veil symbolizes backwardness.
sentences.chinese: 從西方的角度，我想有很多人相信面紗象徵着落後。

sentences.english: And the day's veil fell from the world of sleep.
sentences.chinese: 黎明的面紗便從沉睡的世界中緩緩顯形。

sentences.english: From under the veil, he thought he saw her give him a saucy glance.
sentences.chinese: 他在想，她可能在面紗後面給了自己一個俏皮的一瞥。

sentences.english: A woman in a brown abaya, hijab and gloves proceeded forward.
sentences.chinese: 一個在一個棕色長袍，面紗和手套的女人進行着。

sentences.english: The women there used to veil their faces in public.
sentences.chinese: 那裏的婦女過去在公共場跋通常戴面紗。

sentences.english: 'The moment the dragon comes near you, you must tear off the veil, ' cried he;
sentences.chinese: 等會兒龍來了，你就把面紗扯下來。

definition: to see through/perspective/to examine by fluoroscopy (i.e. X-ray)
cloth head covering worn by men in ancient times/headscarf (typically worn by women)/kerchief/turban
to decorate/to adorn/to dress up/to disguise oneself
